definition: to submit to the will of heaven/to resign oneself to fate/to trust to luck
to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages
smile (archaic)
(literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow
day/sky/heaven
to follow/from/it is for...to/reason/cause/because of/due to/to/to leave it (to sb)/by (introduces passive verb)
life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc

sentences.english: They have abandoned their children to the tender mercies of the social services.
sentences.chinese: 他们遗弃了孩子，任其在社会福利中听天由命。

sentences.english: By late afternoon Alex had become resigned.
sentences.chinese: 接近黄昏时，亚历克斯已经准备听天由命。

sentences.english: You are the angel befallen the stage.
sentences.chinese: 我听天由命，凡降临于我的都是公正的。

sentences.english: You can larn slowly, and sometimes painfully, by just waiting for life to happen to you.
sentences.chinese: 你可以听天由命，慢慢的学，有时候或许会很痛苦。

sentences.english: Before busy, first divide the work, I only a portion to eat not to wash the dishes, it is resigned.
sentences.chinese: 忙前，先分个工，我只吃饭不洗碗，这就听天由命了。

sentences.english: Algren: I think a man does what he can, until his destiny is revealed.
sentences.chinese: 我相信，人应竭尽所能，然后才听天由命。

sentences.english: This was the last blow. Gringoire received it with resignation.
sentences.chinese: 这是最后一个打击，甘果瓦听天由命地接受了。

sentences.english: Is success in life earned or do people succeed because they are lucky?
sentences.chinese: 成功是事在人为还是听天由命？

sentences.english: My choice was to sit back and let life take its course or for me to plan it.
sentences.chinese: 我可以选择听天由命，或是夺过对命运的掌控权。

sentences.english: Oh well, like Trey said, inshallah , which meant, like, whatever.
sentences.chinese: 对了，像特里说的，听天由命。

sentences.english: Submit to the will of Heaven cause they know too much about the world.
sentences.chinese: 它们正因为对这个世界知晓得太多，才这样听天由命。

sentences.english: The trains are often late, so getting to work on time is a fairly hit-and-miss affair.
sentences.chinese: 火车时常晚到，所以上班要准时完全要听天由命。

sentences.english: He lay an image of sadness and resignation waiting his death.
sentences.chinese: 他带着悲哀的，听天由命的神气躺着等死。

definition: to accept misfortunes as decreed by fate/to be resigned to sth
lit. to give medicine to a dead horse (idiom)/fig. to keep trying everything in a desperate situation
pinyin: si3 ma3 dang4 huo2 ma3 yi1

definition: planning is with man, accomplishing with heaven (idiom); Man proposes but God disposes.
pinyin: mou2 shi4 zai4 ren2 , cheng2 shi4 zai4 tian1

definition: Since they have come, we should make them comfortable (idiom). Since we're here, take it easy./Since this is so, we should accept it./Now we have come, let's stay and take the rough with the smooth./If you can't do anything to prevent it, you might as well sit back and enjoy it.
pinyin: ji4 lai2 zhi1 , ze2 an1 zhi1

definition: life and death are ruled by fate (idiom)
to take a laissez-faire attitude
to sit and wait for death (idiom); resigned to one's fate
to have no other choice
there is no alternative
lit. to smash a cracked pot (idiom); crazy despair in the face of a blemish, defect, error or setback
counter soldiers with arms, water with an earth weir (idiom); different situations call for different action/to adopt measures appropriate to the actual situation
pinyin: bing1 lai2 jiang4 dang3 , shui3 lai2 tu3 yan3

definition: lit. to be the meat on sb's chopping block (idiom)/fig. to be at sb's mercy
pinyin: ren2 wei2 dao1 zu3 , wo3 wei2 yu2 rou4

definition: providence/the Will of Heaven
the matter depends on the individual (idiom); it is a matter for your own effort/With effort, one can achieve anything.
impotent (idiom)/powerless/helpless
as matters stand/things having reached this stage
